common_confusions: Do not generalize suffixing behavior from singular reflexives to plurals; plurals place possessive before ɖókui.
Tonal inversion in suffixed singular reflexives is a phonological effect, not an orthographic accident.
strict_rules: Reflexives must be formed using ɖókui combined with possessive pronouns exactly as shown in Lesson XVII (BASIC_EWE_2nd_ed.pdf, p.149).
For plural reflexives, place the possessive pronoun before ɖókui (BASIC_EWE_2nd_ed.pdf, p.149).
Serial verb constructions should be treated as multi-verb sequences within a single clause, sharing tense/aspect as shown in the curriculum.

restrictions.reason: Governance terms (e.g., 'Hlɔtatɔ') must be defined exactly as they appear in the curriculum. Do not invent titles for specific towns not mentioned in the text.
The uploaded Bible PDF contains book titles and page numbers, but not the full verse text. Do not hallucinate verse content.
Do not equate Ewe governance structures (e.g., 'Dufia') directly with Akan structures (e.g., 'Ohene') unless the text explicitly makes that comparison.
The Ewe Bible PDF contains the Table of Contents and Title Page. It does not contain the full verse text. Do not hallucinate verses.
Use only the book titles listed in the PDF (e.g., 'Dɔwɔwɔwo' for Acts). Do not use anglicized names unless they appear in the text.
